page.title: 02Cheriton Bishop Introduction
page.content: Cheriton Bishop is a small village 10 miles west of Exeter just off the A30. It lies on the northern edge of Dartmoor National Park. Until 1978 the A30 main road split the village in half because of the enormous volume of traffic passing through especially during the peak holiday times. Since the construction of the new A30 dual-carriageway about half a mile northwards, the village enjoys tranquility and quick access to Exeter. The community consists of farmers, retired people, daily commuters and local business people. By Mr A Conridge
